data.title: Southwire
data.text:
History

We continue to build on our seven decades of rich history by looking to the future.

From humble beginnings

Our roots extend to 1937 when Roy Richards, a recent graduate of Georgia Tech, started a company to erect power poles. On March 23, 1950, Richards founded Southwire with three used machines and a workforce of 12 employees. Today, Southwireâ€™s reputation for quality and service continues to grow, boasting more than 7,000 employees throughout the world.
